dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Donald Pettit, 70 years old and just back from space—now that's how you celebrate a birthday!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Donald Pettit, seventy years old and just back from space-now that's how you celebrate a birthday!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The oldest active astronaut in the United States, Donald Pettit, celebrated his 70th birthday in an extraordinary way " by returning to Earth after spending seven months aboard the International Space Station, citing Sky News.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Right? Seven months on the ISS, landing on his actual 70th. I mean, talk about a unique party.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? Seven months on the I S S, landing on his actual seventieth. I mean, talk about a unique party.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The oldest active astronaut in the United States, Donald Pettit, celebrated his 70th birthday in an extraordinary way " by returning to Earth after spending seven months aboard the International Space Station, citing Sky News.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And he wasn't alone up there—flew with two Russian cosmonauts, Ovchinin and Vagner.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And he wasn't alone up there-flew with two Russian cosmonauts, Ovchinin and Vagner.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Soyuz MS-26 spacecraft carrying American astronaut Donald Pettit and Russian cosmonauts Aleksey Ovchinin and Ivan Vagner successfully landed in Kazakhstan on Sunday.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, their Soyuz capsule touched down in Kazakhstan, smooth landing, Roscosmos confirmed.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, their Soyuz capsule touched down in Kazakhstan, smooth landing, Roscosmos confirmed.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Soyuz MS-26 spacecraft carrying American astronaut Donald Pettit and Russian cosmonauts Aleksey Ovchinin and Ivan Vagner successfully landed in Kazakhstan on Sunday. Russia's space agency Roscosmos confirmed that the descent from orbit and landing went according to plan.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Can you imagine, uh, orbiting Earth 3,520 times? That's like 93 million miles!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Can you imagine, uh, orbiting Earth three thousand, five hundred twenty times? That's like ninety three million miles!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Over the course of 220 days in orbit, the astronauts completed 3,520 orbits around Earth. ¨Just landed!

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Almost 200 round trips to the moon! Insane mileage for one mission.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Almost two hundred round trips to the moon! Insane mileage for one mission.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ¹Alongside two Russian crewmates, he: Orbited Earth 3,520 times,Traveled 93.3M miles (195 Moon round-trips!)

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And he was busy too—worked on metal 3D printing experiments in microgravity.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And he was busy too-worked on metal 3D printing experiments in microgravity.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: NASA reported that Pettit conducted research aimed at improving metal 3D-printing technologies in space, enhancing water disinfection systems, studying plant growth under different watering regimes, and analyzing the behavior of fire in microgravity.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Oh yeah, plus studying fire behavior and plant watering up there. Not exactly a vacation.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh yeah, plus studying fire behavior and plant watering up there. Not exactly a vacation.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: NASA reported that Pettit conducted research aimed at improving metal 3D-printing technologies in space, enhancing water disinfection systems, studying plant growth under different watering regimes, and analyzing the behavior of fire in microgravity.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: This was his fourth spaceflight, right? Dude's a veteran.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: This was his fourth spaceflight, right? Dude's a veteran.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: It was the fourth spaceflight for both Pettit and Ovchinin, and the second for Vagner.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. And at 70, still active—oldest U.S. astronaut in the game.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. And at seventy, still active-oldest U.S. astronaut in the game.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: According to Sky News, Donald Pettit is currently the oldest active astronaut in the U.S.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Landed on a Sunday after launching back in September. What a way to wrap up the mission.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Landed on a Sunday after launching back in September. What a way to wrap up the mission.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Soyuz MS-26 spacecraft carrying American astronaut Donald Pettit and Russian cosmonauts Aleksey Ovchinin and Ivan Vagner successfully landed in Kazakhstan on Sunday. The crew's seven-month scientific mission began on September 11, 2024.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Bet that birthday cake back on Earth tasted extra good after 220 days of space food.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Bet that birthday cake back on Earth tasted extra good after two hundred twenty days of space food.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Over the course of 220 days in orbit, the astronauts completed 3,520 orbits around Earth.
